visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart displaying the monthly average temperature for four cities: Tokyo, New York, Berlin, and London. The chart should have a title 'Monthly Average Temperature' and a subtitle 'Source: WorldClimate.com'. The x-axis should represent the months from January to December, and the y-axis should represent the temperature in degrees Celsius. The chart should include custom colors for each series, and the legend should be styled with a title and a note about hiding series on click. Additionally, the chart should have a tooltip displaying the temperature value with the suffix '°C'.

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart that visualizes the monthly average temperature for four cities: Tokyo, New York, Berlin, and London. The chart includes a title and subtitle, with the x-axis representing the months and the y-axis representing the temperature in degrees Celsius. The x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with a dark color and a specific font size. The y-axis also includes a plot line at 0°C. The tooltip displays the temperature value with the suffix '°C'. The legend is styled with a title and a note about hiding series on click, and it is positioned vertically on the right side of the chart. Each series in the chart is assigned a custom color, and the colors are also specified in the 'colors' array to ensure consistency. This configuration ensures a clear and informative visualization of the temperature data across the specified cities and months.
